intro: Machaerina mariscoides, commonly known as the coastal machaerina, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the daisies family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or rocky soils. It has adapted to withstand strong winds and salt spray, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Machaerina mariscoides plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for native insects and birds.
